scheme_name: Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Dependants (For Other State)
brief_description: "Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Dependants (For Other State)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home that provides a monthly pension to the dependents of the injured/jailed agitators from other states during the Uttarakhand State Movement.
detailed_description: "Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Nominees/Dependents (For Other State)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹4,500/- to the nominees/dependents of the injured agitators who were jailed for 7 days from other states during the Uttarakhand State Movement. This pension shall be entitled to the dependents of those agitators who are not recipients of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes or not employed in government service after their death.
eligibility_criteria: Applicant should be a dependent of an agitator who was jailed for 7 days or injured during the Uttarakhand State Movement. Applicant should not be recipients of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes or not employed in government service.

steps: Step 1: The applicant needs to submit an application to the office of the District Magistrate (there is no prescribed format for application). Step 2: Attach all the mandatory documents (Self-attested, if required) along with the application form. Step 3: Submit the application at the office of the District Magistrate.

documents_required: Application form. Any other documents as required.
